definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Yi/abbr. for 伊拉克[Yi1 la1 ke4], Iraq/abbr. for 伊朗[Yi1 lang3], Iran

(old) third person singular pronoun ("he" or "she")/second person singular pronoun ("you")/(May 4th period) third person singular feminine pronoun ("she")/(Classical Chinese) introductory particle with no specific meaning/that (preceding a noun)

sentences.english: Many mummies have been found in the Silk Road.
sentences.chinese: 在丝绸之路发现了许多木乃伊。

sentences.english: A naturally mummified Chinchorro child found in a Chilean desert.
sentences.chinese: 一具在智利沙漠发现的自然风干的新克罗小孩木乃伊。

sentences.english: China's Mystery Mummies takes viewers to the Tarim Basin.
sentences.chinese: 《中国神秘木乃伊》将带观众一访塔里木盆地。

sentences.english: The mummy wore bead necklaces and had a gold bowl over her face.
sentences.chinese: 木乃伊戴有彩珠项链并用金钵盖脸。

sentences.english: Neroli was once an oil heavily used in embalming those who were mummified in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 橙花曾是一种在古代大量用于给木乃伊涂香油的精油。

sentences.english: Mummy and daddy have counted all the sheep.
sentences.chinese: 木乃伊和爸爸有计算所有的羊。

sentences.english: Her novel featured a mummy coming back to life and seeking revenge against an archaeologist.
sentences.chinese: 她的小说表现了一个木乃伊复活并向考古学家复仇。

sentences.english: Sorry, pal. There's a mummy on the loose.
sentences.chinese: 对不起啦，朋友，那边有个木乃伊在乱动。

sentences.english: This god which has the head of a cow was normally placed inside a mummy.
sentences.chinese: 这种牛头人身的神像通常被放在木乃伊体内。

sentences.english: I gave this step a genius nickname: mummifying a last.
sentences.chinese: 我把这一步笑称为“鞋楦的木乃伊化”。

sentences.english: Luckily, the mummies are well preserved.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，这些木乃伊都保存得宜。

sentences.english: An English scientist claims to have unlocked the secrets of mummification.
sentences.chinese: 一名英国科学家宣称已经解开了木乃伊制作的秘密。

sentences.english: That one sits staring like a mummy.
sentences.chinese: 一个坐在那里傻瞪着眼，活像一座木乃伊。

sentences.english: Some mummies had calcification in up to 6 different arteries.
sentences.chinese: 有些木乃伊钙化的部位竟多达6处。

sentences.english: Now move to the right and dig out the one-block column, freeing the mummy.
sentences.chinese: 再往右移，挖一个区块的柱子，把木乃伊放出来。

definition: Tutankhamen, king of ancient Egypt 1333-1323 BC
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
